info.title: Document360 Customer API
info.description:
Document360 RESTful APIs will allow you to integrate your documentation with your software, allowing you to easily onboard new users, manage your articles and more. 

You can find detailed API documentation here : [API Documentation](https://apidocs.document360.io/docs)

parameters.name: isForDisplay
parameters.description: Set this to true, if you are displaying the article to the end-user. If true, the content of snippets or variables appears in the article. Note: If the value is true, ensure that the article content is not passed for update article endpoints.

parameters.name: isPublished
parameters.description:
**true** : You will get the latest published version of the article. (If there are no published versions, then it will return the latest version)            
**false** : To get the the latest version of the article

parameters.name: appendSASToken
parameters.description: Set this to false to exclude appending SAS token for images/files

data.title: Knowledge bases are much easier to design and edit
data.content: Have you ever edited a Wikipedia page? You have to break the flow of text to add tags, and when you want to connect two articles together you have to just hope that nobody changes the other article’s name, lest you end up with a rusty red “dead link.”To be fair,Wikipedia has actually made good strides in making their Wiki software easy to use for anybody, but opening up the editor is still a bit of a shock since you don’t see the familiar webpage you just clicked on. With a knowledge base, what you see is what you get.You don’t have to train anybody on how to add or edit pages because the whole thing is extremely intuitive. Anybody can learn to navigate an edit page in seconds flat.

data.title: Knowledge bases are much easier to design and edit
data.content: Have you ever edited a Wikipedia page? You have to break the flow of text to add tags, and when you want to connect two articles together you have to just hope that nobody changes the other article’s name, lest you end up with a rusty red “dead link.”To be fair,Wikipedia has actually made good strides in making their Wiki software easy to use for anybody, but opening up the editor is still a bit of a shock since you don’t see the familiar webpage you just clicked on. With a knowledge base, what you see is what you get.You don’t have to train anybody on how to add or edit pages because the whole thing is extremely intuitive. Anybody can learn to navigate an edit page in seconds flat.

Sample requests:
            
    POST /Export - Export all the versions in the documentation
    {
       "entity": "Project", // Project / version
       "versionId": [], // should be empty array 
       "SelectedLanguages":[],
       "SelectedCategories":[],
       "FilterByArticleModifiedAt": {  // filter articles by modified at date range
           "after": "2021-05-17T03:42:52.109Z",
            "before": "2021-05-17T03:42:52.109Z"
       },
       "excludeMediaFiles": true // exculde media files on export
    }
            
    POST /Export - Export specific versions in the documentation
    {
       "entity": "Version", // Project / version
       "versionId": ["695782c0-a0a3-4664-9bfd-0197d26379ee"],
       "SelectedLanguages":[],
       "SelectedCategories":[],
       "FilterByArticleModifiedAt": {  // filter articles by modified at date range
           "after": "2021-05-17T03:42:52.109Z",
            "before": "2021-05-17T03:42:52.109Z"
       },
       "excludeMediaFiles": true // exculde media files on export
    }

hits.title: Understanding Home page builder
hits.content:
The home page is the first page an end-user will see when they visit your knowledge base. The Home Page Builder lets you customize your home page by adding links, changing colors, including categories from your knowledge base, and more. 
 The home page builder comes with an intuitive interface to design a professional looking front-page to your knowledge base. You do not need any developer support to create a good looking home page. 
 If you do not want a home page and would like to direct the user directly to the real content, you can easily turn off the home page for your knowledge base. 
 
                
                This is a sample article, you can safely delete it.

value.prompt: How to configure single sign-on in Document360?
value.result:
To configure Single Sign On in Document360, follow these steps:



  1. Access the Azure AD portal and log in to your Microsoft Azure account.

  2. Add your application by logging in to your Azure account, visiting the Azure portal page, and selecting the New application option.

  3. Navigate to Document360 portal, select Settings → Users Security → SAML/OpenID → SAML, and set up your application by copying the parameters from Document360 to the Azure AD portal.

  4. Configure SAML based SSO settings by copying and pasting values between Document360 and Azure AD portal.

  5. Test the configuration by logging into Document360 using the credentials added to the registered application.

category_id.description: Category ID for updating the content

lang_code.description: Language Code for updating the content

content.description: The content of the category, for any Editor type, use this property.

html_content.description: The HTML content of the category. If the editor type is WYSIWYG (HTML), use this property - (This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the API, Kindly use **content** property instead of this.)

block_content.description: The HTML content of the category. If the editor type is Block Editor (HTML), use this property - (This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the API, Kindly use **content** property instead of this.)

version_number.description: The version number of the category to be updated. The latest version is updated by default.

translation_option.description: Translation status of the category. 0 - None, 1 - Needs translation, 2 Translated

source.description: Free text used for future reference

updated_by.description: The ID of the team account responsible for the category update

order.description: The position of the category. By default, it will be added at the end of the parent category.

parent_category_id.description: The ID of the category where the category will be moved. By default, it will be created at the first level.

hidden.description: Visibility status of the category. **true** - Category will be hidden; **false** - Category will be shown

icon.description: The icon of the category. Specify the Unicode icon. Example: 📜 (Windows 10 - Win key + . or Mac ⌃-⌘-Space Bar to open emoji menu)

language.description: Language code of the category. If language is not specified, the category would be updated in the default language.

extension_data.description: Extention data for customer API response

success.description: Status indication for customer API response

errors.description: Errors in the customer API response

warnings.description: Warnings in the customer API response

information.description: Information passed by the customer API response

name.description: The new name for the folder being updated

folder_color.description: The color of the folder - should be in hexadecimal color code format

is_starred.description: To update the folder as starred

title.description: The name of the reader group.

associated_readers.description:
List of reader IDs to be associated with this reader group.
Note: Reader IDs that were previously associated but not present in this list during the update will be dissociated from this reader group.

access_scope.description: Access level of this reader group.

associated_invited_sso_users.description:
List of invitation IDs to be associated with this reader group.
Note: Invitation IDs that were previously associated but not present in this list during the update will be disassociated from this reader group.

first_name.description: The first name of the reader

last_name.description: The last name of the reader

associated_reader_groups.description: List of reader group IDs. If the value is null or not given, then the reader would be removed from all associated reader groups.

is_invitation_id.description: Applicable only for Single Sign-On readers. Set this property to true, if the reader is a Single Sign-On reader who hasn't logged in to the application yet.

sso_user_type.description: SSO user type 0 - Normal user, 1 - SSO user, 2 - Invited SSO user
SSO user type 0 - Normal user, 1 - SSO user, 2 - Invited SSO user

api_token.description: Enter REST API key. To generate a key, go to Settings → Knowledge base portal → API tokens
api_token.name: api_token
